Title: ALICE IN WONDERLAND | New Official Full Trailer (HQ) | Official Disney UK
Description:
From Walt Disney Pictures and visionary director Tim Burton comes an epic fantasy adventure ALICE IN WONDERLAND, a magical and imaginative twist on some of the most beloved stories of all time. JOHNNY DEPP stars as the Mad Hatter and MIA WASIKOWSKA as 19-year-old Alice, who returns to the whimsical world she first encountered as a young girl, reuniting with her childhood friends: the White Rabbit, Tweedledee and Tweedledum, the Dormouse, the Caterpillar, the Cheshire Cat, and of course, the Mad Hatter. Alice embarks on a fantastical journey to find her true destiny and end the Red Queen’s reign of terror. The all-star cast also includes ANNE HATHAWAY, HELENA BONHAM CARTER and CRISPIN GLOVER.

Subscribe to Disney UK: http://bit.ly/subscribe-to-disney  
Follow us on Twitter: https://twitter.com/Disney_UK 
Like our official Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/DisneyUK

Capturing the wonder of Lewis Carroll’s beloved “Alice’s Adventures in Wonderland” (1865) and “Through the Looking-Glass” (1871) with stunning, avant-garde visuals and the most charismatic characters in literary history, ALICE IN WONDERLAND is available to own on DVD, Blu-Ray and Digital HD.

Comments.author: @darcon81
Comments.text: What is disdainful with these fairy tale film adaptations is that they're completely taking away the fairy tale feel of it and injecting 21st century feel of it. They're making some monsters scary when they're supposed to be goofy; they've turned princesses into femme fatales, naive characters into dashing and daring ones with witty one liners. The charm and enchantment are lost and replaced by effects. Fairy tales are supposed to be fun because of its plot not because of the explosions n stuff.

Comments.author: @RurouniKon
Comments.text: lcukgirl55: It's supposed to be the Red Queen, not the Queen of Hearts. Both characters are quite similar -- I don't think it's a mistake. The move is set between Disney's first Alice in Wonderland (from the animated 1930's version) and Lewis Carrol's Through the Looking Glass. So it's a mixture of both novel's characters.
